DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: GONÇALVES, A. B.;BARBACEIA GONÇALVES, ADALTO;GONÇALVES, ADALTO BARBACEIA

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Professor Associado do Insper, com Doutorado em administração de empresas linha Finanças pela FGV. Visiting Scholar na University of Illinois - Urbana-Champaign.. Obteve o título de Master of Business Administration em finanças e modelos econométricos pela Anderson School of Management da UCLA e de Engenheiro Civil pela Escola Politécnica da USP. 
Atua como Professor de finanças e economia do Insper nos cursos de mestrado, graduação, pós-graduação e educação executiva desde 2005. Tem trajetória profissional com passagem pelo mercado financeiro, asset management e tesouraria bem como finanças corporativas. Tem interesse de pesquisa em crédito comercial ("trade credit"), poder de mercado, performance de fundos de investimento e finanças corporativas.
Trabalhou no Itaú desenvolvendo modelos de suporte à decisão e estruturação de hedging e derivativos para a tesouraria na Vice Presidência Financeira. Fundou e geriu a Axioma Informática que atuou mais de 20 anos como pioneira e líder em desenvolvimento software utilizado pelos principais gestores e administradores de fundos de investimento no Brasil. Atuou em consultoria e cursos executivos para o mercado financeiro com clientes como Bradesco, Citibank, HSBC, Itaú-Unibanco, Petros, Philips Seguridade Social, Western Asset Management, Legg Mason, Brasilprev, SunGard, ABN Amro, e Banco Alfa.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
?	PhD in Finance at EAESP-FGV-São Paulo.
?	Visiting Scholar at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
?	Civil Engineer at Escola Politécnica da Universidade de São Paulo (1981).
?	Mater in Business Administration from University of California - UCLA Anderson School of Management (1985). 
Finance and Economics Professor at Insper Instituto de Ensino e Pesquisa since 2005. 
Financial Analyst at Banco Itaú developing decision support models for hedging and fixed income and derivatives treasury operations. Founded and managed Axioma informatica, a pioneer company in financial software, consulting and training for the Brazilian financial market for more than 20 years.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Modelos de medicao de Risco e retorno em Investimentos em Startups
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
A avaliação de risco e retorno de Startups é difícil por falta de
divulgação de valores de suas ações ou cotas (observado apenas quando há um evento de liquidez e que e autodeclarado). Isto gera diversos vieses na metrica, alem do vies de selecao. Analisamos como tratar esse tema no Brasil de forma econométrica válida (ex.: procedimento de Heckman para correção do viés de seleção).

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Atividades auxiliares dos serviços financeiros, seguros, previdência complementar e planos de saúde

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Forecasting interest rates structures plays a fundamental role in the fixed income and bond markets. The development of dynamic modeling, especially after Nelson and Siegel (1987) work, parsimonious models based in a few parameter shed light over a new path for the market players. Despite the extensive literature on the term structure of interest rates modeling and the existence in the Brazilian market of various yield curves from different traded asset classes, the literature focused only in the fixed rate curve. In this work we expand the existing literature on modeling the term structure of Brazilian interest rates evaluating all the yield curves of Brazilian market using the methodology proposed by Nelson and Siegel. We use Non Linear Least Squares (NLLS) to estimate the model parameters for almost 10 years of monthly data and model these parameters with the traditional VAR/VEC model. The results show that it is possible to estimate the Nelson Siegel model for the Brazilian curves. It remains for future research the modeling of their variances as well as the possibility to develop a global Brazilian model using Kalman Filter using the Diebold. Li. and Yue (2006) approach.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Forecasting interest rates structures plays a fundamental role in the fixed income and bond markets. The development of dynamic modeling, especially after Nelson and Siegel (1987) work, parsimonious models based in a few parameter shed light over a new path for the market players. Despite the extensive literature on the term structure of interest rates modeling and the existence in the Brazilian market of various yield curves from different traded asset classes, the literature focused only in the fixed rate curve. In this work we expand the existing literature on modeling the term structure of Brazilian interest rates evaluating all the yield curves of Brazilian market using the methodology proposed by Nelson and Siegel. We use Non Linear Least Squares (NLLS) to estimate the model parameters for almost 10 years of monthly data and model these parameters with the traditional VAR/VEC model. The results show that it is possible to estimate the Nelson Siegel model for the Brazilian curves. It remains for future research the modeling of their variances as well as the possibility to develop a global Brazilian model using Kalman Filter using the Diebold. Li. and Yue (2006) approach.

Trade Credit during Financial Crisis: Do Market Power and Financial Constraints Matter?
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Trade Credit during Financial Crisis: Do Market Power and Financial Constraints Matter?

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
We investigate whether market power affects trade credit
decisions. We explore several financial crises in Argentina, Brazil, Mexico and
the US that work as exogenous shocks to the supply of short and long term
financing for nonfinancial firms. We find that firms with high market power
increase the supply of net trade credit to their customers during and after a
financial crisis, whereas firms with low market power reduce net trade credit
terms offered to their clients. The effects of market power and financial
constraints work as separate channels in the trade credit policy decisions. Our
results contribute with the previous literature by documenting an effect of product
market competition on trade credit decisions.
